item.title: Asian shares rise after Japan's prime minister resigns
item.description: Global shares are mostly higher with Japan’s benchmark rising after Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced that he plans to resign

item.title: China's export growth slows in August as US tariffs and trade tensions bite
item.description: China's customs agency reports that the country's exports grew last month, but at a slower pace than in recent months

item.title: Norway votes in a closely fought election with the future of a wealth tax in focus

item.title: South Korea will bring home 300 workers detained in massive Hyundai plant raid in Georgia
item.description: South Korea says it has reached a deal with the U.S. for the release of South Korean workers detained in an immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Geo...

item.title: Japan's economy grew at faster rate in fiscal Q1 than initially thought
item.description: Japan’s economy expanded at a stronger rate in the fiscal first quarter than previously estimated, despite worries about U.S. tariffs and domestic pol...
